This is an [R Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) Notebook, outlining the different commands asked in Task 5 of 2.11 of the course textbook

library() opens a window that lists the packages that are installed on your computer;
```{r}
library()
```
library() opens a window that lists the packages that are installed on your computer;
```{r}
search()
```
Install seqinr from the closest CRAN mirror and load it for this session.
```{r}
?install.packages

# Note: the parameter is a quoted string!
install.packages("seqinr",repos="https://cran.rstudio.com/")   
```
launch a new window with the seqinr package info
```{r}
library(seqinr)
```
list all the functions available in the seqinr package.
```{r}
ls("package:seqinr")
```
run a sample function 
```{r}
seqinr::a("Tyr")
```
```{r}
seqinr::words(3, c("A", "G", "C", "U"))
```

**Testing of various functions**
?data -> launches a help page about datasets
data available for seqinr:

```{r}
data(package="seqinr")  
```

load aaindex 
```{r}
data(aaindex, package="seqinr") 
```
an example of data available is pK values for the side chain of charged amino acids from various sources

```{r}
plot(aaindex$FASG890101$I,
     aaindex$PONJ960101$I,
     xlab="hydrophobicity", ylab="volume", type="n")
text(aaindex$FASG890101$I,
     aaindex$PONJ960101$I,
     labels=a(names(aaindex$FASG890101$I)))
```
another graphing example:

```{r}
seqinr::choosebank("swissprot")
mySeq <- seqinr::query("mySeq", "N=MBP1_YEAST")
mbp1 <- seqinr::getSequence(mySeq)
seqinr::closebank()
x <- seqinr::AAstat(mbp1[[1]])
barplot(sort(x$Compo), cex.names = 0.6)
```
